content.question: A ball is swung in a vertical circle such that at one point along its circular path the forces exerted on the ball can be represented by the free body diagram. The magnitude of the tension force exerted on the ball, <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is twice that of the force due to gravity exerted on the ball from Earth, <math alttext="F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the location of the ball, and what is the magnitude of the centripetal acceleration of the ball?

choices.label: LocationAccelerationBottom of the circle<math alttext="3 g" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></math>
LocationAccelerationTop of the circle<math alttext="3 g" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></math>

content.answer: LocationAccelerationTop of the circle<math alttext="3 g" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></math>
